revised_title: An Investigation into the Origin and Transport of Strange Beans Found on the Orkney Isles
tldr: The author, Hans Sloane, examines four types of beans found on the Orkney Isles and investigates their origin, suggesting that they may have been carried there by ocean currents from Jamaica, where three of the four types grow. Sloane also discusses the possibility of these beans being transported to Scotland via wind patterns and currents, and compares their journey to the known voyages of Christopher Columbus.
